answers.author: Douglas Lewis
answers.text:
Hi Brian:
The City of Painesville, Ohio (pop. 19,000) conducts site plan review in-house.  We have a City Planner and City Engineer that organizes a meeting the all Departments.  Each Department has a person assigned to review site plans.  The meeting is set up and the City Planner and Engineer review the project and provide the site plan review committee with with a copy of the site plan.  We provide time to submit comments.  Once comments are submitted by each Department, the City Planner puts together the comments and reviews them.  The comments are then provided to the developer or engineer for the developer to make the recommended modifications.  Stormwater review on site plans is done by Lake County Water and Soil Conservation District.  Call me at 440-392-5802 if you have any questions.

author: Brian Chapman
text:
Hello,
The City of Oshkosh (pop. 68,000) is currently redesigning it's Site Plan Review process in attempt to make it more streamlined and customer friendly. If your organization currently has a Site Plan Review process, could you please take a minute and answer the questions below.
Thanks.
Brian Chapman 
Do you have a formal Site Plan Review Process? If so, could you describe the process? 
What Departments are involved?
How many employees are involved with the Site Plan Review Process?
Do you track or record process time, the number of submittals, and the number of re-submittals? If so, could you share your metrics? 
Is the Site Plan Review conducted in house or by a contractor?
Is any aspect of the review contracted out? 
Do you have a self certification program or offer any education sessions for outside engineers, developers, etc?
Do you use a customer service survey to gauge satisfaction levels from engineers, developers, etc? If so, how often do you conduct the survey? At the completion of a project, annually, etc. Could you please provide me with a copy of your survey?
title: Questions about your Site Plan Review Process
